column2: plot_acquittal <- ggplot(df, aes(x = diff_acquittal, y = GDP)) +
geom_text(aes(x = -4, y = 2750000, label = "Higher Acquittal Rates\n for Women"), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 1) +
geom_text(aes(x = 7.5, y = 2750000, label = "Higher Acquittal Rates\n for Men"), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 1) +
title = "Diffirence in Acquittal Rate  vs. GDP",

caption = "Source: Development Data Lab
Government of India Ministry of Statistics
Note: This plot shows the relationship between the Diff_Acquittal variable and statewide GDP.The Diff_Acquittal 
 variable was generated by subtracting the Acquittal Rate for Female Defendants from the Acquittal Rate for Male 
 Defendants. A positive difference indicates that men were acquitted more, on average, then women. A negative
 difference indicates that women were acquitted at higher rates then men. A simple line of best fit shows a slight 
 negative correlation between the difference in acquittal rate and GDP.  N = 224 "
plot_dismissal <- ggplot(df, aes(x = diff_dismissal, y = GDP )) +
geom_text(aes(x = -10, y = 2750000, label = "Higher Dismissal Rates\n for Women"), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 1) +
geom_text(aes(x = 3, y = 2750000, label = "Higher Dismissal Rates\n for Men"), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 1) +
title = "Difference in Dismissal Rate vs. GDP",

caption = "Source: Development Data Lab
Government of India Ministry of Statistics
Note: This plot shows the relationship between the Diff_Dismissal variable and statewide GDP.The Diff_Dismissal 
 variable was generated by subtracting the Dismissal Rate for Female Defendants from the Dismissal Rate for Male 
 Defendants. A positive difference indicates that men were dismissed more, on average, then women. A negative
 difference indicates that women were dismissed at higher rates then men. A simple line of best fit shows a  very slight 
 positive correlation between the difference in dismissal rate and GDP.  N = 224 "
plot_conviction <- ggplot(df, aes(x = diff_conviction, y = GDP)) +
geom_text(aes(x = -4, y = 2750000, label = "Higher Conviction Rates\n for Women"), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 1) +
geom_text(aes(x = 6, y = 2750000, label = "Higher Conviction Rates\n for Men"), hjust = 0.5, vjust = 1) +
title = "Difference in Conviction Rate vs. GDP",

caption = "Source: Development Data Lab
Government of India Ministry of Statistics
Note: This plot shows the relationship between the Diff_Conviction variable and statewide GDP.The Diff_Conviction 
 variable was generated by subtracting the Conviction Rate for Female Defendants from the Conviction Rate for Male 
 Defendants. A positive difference indicates that men were convicted more, on average, then women. A negative
 difference indicates that women were convicted at higher rates then men. A simple line of best fit shows a slight 
 positive correlation between the difference in conviction rate and GDP.  N = 224"
